page.title: 03The Video Shop,Hutton
page.content: In Woodlands Avenue there is a row of shops next to Arnolds Avenue.One of the shops was a bakers and a wool shop.After these shops closed down a video shop called{"Video Ville" opened.In the first two weeks it was broken into.The two burglars got away with some tapes and a video recorder. They broke into the video shop by backing a lorry into the front doors. About four weeks later it was broken into again.This time by the back entrance.If they had broken into it by the front entrance an alarm would have gone off.This time the burglar got away with nothing.Soon after the second break_in the shop closed down. After it closed down it was decided to turn it into a take away.When they applied for planning permission it was refused because of possible nuisance to residents.
